result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott R Bayer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott R Bayer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Scott R Bayer was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid in 120 days or penalty of 5 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.

STRAIGHT TIME. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 62 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Case 15CM227

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Scott R Bayer in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count#2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed outright.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Masnica makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:

120 DAYS JAIL STRAIGHT TIME  (CREDIT - 62 DAYS)  **CONCURRENT WITH CASE #15CM227**

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid in 120 days, alternate 5 days jail if not paid)
Jury trial - 12 person on April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on April 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Scott R Bayer in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Masnica requests speedy trial and a plea and sentence date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Jury status hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Scott R Bayer in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
